Platform.Title: USITB Escherichia coli W3110 9.2k array v 1.0
Platform.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Platform.Manufacturer: University of Stuttgart, Institute of Technical Biochemistry, Allmandring 31, 70569 Stuttgart
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Whole genome E. coli K12 DNA-microarrays were printed using the Microgrid II robot of Biorobotics (now Genomic Solutions, Huntingdon, United Kingdom) by spotting oligonucleotides (50mer, dissolved in buffer A; E. coli K-12 V2 Oligo set from MWG, Ebersberg, Germany) representing all E. coli K-12 ORFs on epoxy-coated glass slides (MWG) as duplicates. Oligonucleotides were delivered in 12 384 polypropylene microtiter plates with F-bottom (Greiner, Frickenhausen, Germany). For details on probe design please see the manufacturer’s protocol (http://ecom2.mwgdna.com/services/array/download.tcl). Tungsten microarray split pins (PT 3000 – Point Technologies, Inc., Colorado, USA) were used for spotting. 27 slides were manufactured per printing process. 3 slides were discarded as so called “pre-spot slides”, 24 slides were used for microarray experiments. Printing was performed using the following conditions (Software: TAS Application Suite V. 2.6.0.2): • Tool: 4x4 configuration • Group (Tool Type): 2. Micro Spot (384 Well) • Source Action: dwell/remove one lid at a time • 60 spots / source visit, 10 of them were pre spots • soft touch distance: 1.5 mm • humidity control: minimal: 58%; target humidity: 63% • washing conditions: 3 x at the beginning, 5 x at the end, bath 1 two seconds, bath 2 three seconds (2 mm wiggle); washing solution: ddH2O. • all replikates were printed on the first slide first. After printing, microarrays were incubated in a hybridization oven (Whatman Biometra) at 42°C over night together with a ddH2O filled petri dish covered with looped aluminium foil. Afterwards, microarrays were washed stirring constantly with 0.2 % SDS solution (2 min), two times in ddH2O (1 min) at room temperature and afterwards incubated in the hybridization oven (Whatman Biometra) for 20 min in ddH2O at 50°C. Microarrays were nitrogen dried and stored in a dark and dry place until hybridization. Quality control: staining with SYBR SafeTM DNA Gel Stain (MolecularProbes) by incubation of the printed area with 750 µL of the solution and incubation for 3 min at room temperature. Arrays were washed four times with 0.5 x TBE-Puffer (5 x stock solution: Tris-Borat 0.45 M; EDTA 0.01 M) and scanned afterwards. For data analysis, a “gal file” was produced using the software TAS application suite version 2.6.0.2 from Genomic Solutions.
Platform.Catalog-Number: MWG E. coli K12 V2 oligo set (MWG, Ebersberg, Germany): order number: 2340-000000 (for more information: http://ecom2.mwgdna.com/services/array/download.tcl)

Column.Name: Function
Column.Description: information on feature (specified in SPOT_ID) and gene, respectively

Sample.Title: E.coli_T1viaR_SR1

Channel.Source: E. coli, glucose limitation (glucose concentration < 0.05 gL-1), fed-batch
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, glucose limitation (glucose concentration < 0.05 gL-1)
Channel.Biomaterial-Provider: DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures, organism cultivated by University of Stuttgart, Institute of Biochemical Engineering, Allmandring 31, 70569 Stuttgart
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: The culture medium samples were withdrawn with a capillary sampling probe as developed by Theobald et al. (1997), however, without using membrane-covered glass tubes. The cell samples were collected directly into RNAprotect Bacteria Reagent (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) to avoid RNA degradation. The samples were centrifuged according to the manufacturer’s protocol and frozen at - 80 °C until RNA isolation. Theobald, U., Mailinger,W., Baltes, M., Rizzi, M., Reuss, M., 1997. In vivo analysis of metabolic dynamics in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. 1. Experimental observations. Biotechnol. Bioeng. 55, 305–316.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The fed-batch cultivations were carried out with the bacterial strain E. coli K-12 W3110 (DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures) in a 30-l bioreactor (Bioengineering AG, Wald, Switzerland). Minimal medium supplemented with glucose as the carbon source was used. The batch medium (batch volume VR,0 =17 l) consisted of 8.8 g l−1 glucose•H2O, 2.0 g l−1 Na2SO4•10H2O, 2.68 g l−1 (NH4)2SO4, 1.0 g l−1 NH4Cl, 14.6 g l−1 K2HPO4, 4.02 g l−1 NaH2PO4•2H2O, 0.01 g l−1 thiamine HCl; 0.3mM CaCl2•2H2O, 2mM MgSO4•7H2O; 3ml l−1 of trace element solution (TES: 16.7 g l−1 FeCl3•6H2O, 20.1 g l−1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Sample.Title: E.coli_RviaT2_SR1

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Biomaterial-Provider: DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures, organism cultivated by University of Stuttgart, Institute of Biochemical Engineering, Allmandring 31, 70569 Stuttgart
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: The culture medium samples were withdrawn with a capillary sampling probe as developed by Theobald et al. (1997), however, without using membrane-covered glass tubes. The cell samples were collected directly into RNAprotect Bacteria Reagent (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) to avoid RNA degradation. The samples were centrifuged according to the manufacturer’s protocol and frozen at - 80 °C until RNA isolation. Theobald, U., Mailinger,W., Baltes, M., Rizzi, M., Reuss, M., 1997. In vivo analysis of metabolic dynamics in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. 1. Experimental observations. Biotechnol. Bioeng. 55, 305–316.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The fed-batch cultivations were carried out with the bacterial strain E. coli K-12 W3110 (DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures) in a 30-l bioreactor (Bioengineering AG, Wald, Switzerland). Minimal medium supplemented with glucose as the carbon source was used. The batch medium (batch volume VR,0 =17 l) consisted of 8.8 g l−1 glucose•H2O, 2.0 g l−1 Na2SO4•10H2O, 2.68 g l−1 (NH4)2SO4, 1.0 g l−1 NH4Cl, 14.6 g l−1 K2HPO4, 4.02 g l−1 NaH2PO4•2H2O, 0.01 g l−1 thiamine HCl; 0.3mM CaCl2•2H2O, 2mM MgSO4•7H2O; 3ml l−1 of trace element solution (TES: 16.7 g l−1 FeCl3•6H2O, 20.1 g l−1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, glucose limitation, 50 min after depletion of extracellular acetate
Channel.Biomaterial-Provider: DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures, organism cultivated by University of Stuttgart, Institute of Biochemical Engineering, Allmandring 31, 70569 Stuttgart
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: The culture medium samples were withdrawn with a capillary sampling probe as developed by Theobald et al. (1997), however, without using membrane-covered glass tubes. The cell samples were collected directly into RNAprotect Bacteria Reagent (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) to avoid RNA degradation. The samples were centrifuged according to the manufacturer’s protocol and frozen at - 80 °C until RNA isolation. Theobald, U., Mailinger,W., Baltes, M., Rizzi, M., Reuss, M., 1997. In vivo analysis of metabolic dynamics in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. 1. Experimental observations. Biotechnol. Bioeng. 55, 305–316.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The fed-batch cultivations were carried out with the bacterial strain E. coli K-12 W3110 (DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures) in a 30-l bioreactor (Bioengineering AG, Wald, Switzerland). Minimal medium supplemented with glucose as the carbon source was used. The batch medium (batch volume VR,0 =17 l) consisted of 8.8 g l−1 glucose•H2O, 2.0 g l−1 Na2SO4•10H2O, 2.68 g l−1 (NH4)2SO4, 1.0 g l−1 NH4Cl, 14.6 g l−1 K2HPO4, 4.02 g l−1 NaH2PO4•2H2O, 0.01 g l−1 thiamine HCl; 0.3mM CaCl2•2H2O, 2mM MgSO4•7H2O; 3ml l−1 of trace element solution (TES: 16.7 g l−1 FeCl3•6H2O, 20.1 g l−1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, glucose limitation, acetate concentration ≤ 0.35 gL-1
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, glucose limitation, acetate concentration ≤ 0.35 gL-1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Sample.Title: E.coli_RviaT8_SR2

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Biomaterial-Provider: DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures, organism cultivated by University of Stuttgart, Institute of Biochemical Engineering, Allmandring 31, 70569 Stuttgart
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: The culture medium samples were withdrawn with a capillary sampling probe as developed by Theobald et al. (1997), however, without using membrane-covered glass tubes. The cell samples were collected directly into RNAprotect Bacteria Reagent (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) to avoid RNA degradation. The samples were centrifuged according to the manufacturer’s protocol and frozen at - 80 °C until RNA isolation. Theobald, U., Mailinger,W., Baltes, M., Rizzi, M., Reuss, M., 1997. In vivo analysis of metabolic dynamics in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. 1. Experimental observations. Biotechnol. Bioeng. 55, 305–316.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The fed-batch cultivations were carried out with the bacterial strain E. coli K-12 W3110 (DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures) in a 30-l bioreactor (Bioengineering AG, Wald, Switzerland). Minimal medium supplemented with glucose as the carbon source was used. The batch medium (batch volume VR,0 =17 l) consisted of 8.8 g l−1 glucose•H2O, 2.0 g l−1 Na2SO4•10H2O, 2.68 g l−1 (NH4)2SO4, 1.0 g l−1 NH4Cl, 14.6 g l−1 K2HPO4, 4.02 g l−1 NaH2PO4•2H2O, 0.01 g l−1 thiamine HCl; 0.3mM CaCl2•2H2O, 2mM MgSO4•7H2O; 3ml l−1 of trace element solution (TES: 16.7 g l−1 FeCl3•6H2O, 20.1 g l−1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Sample.Title: E.coli_T3viaR_SR2

Channel.Source: E. coli, glucose limitation, 30 min after depletion of extracellular acetate
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, glucose limitation, 30 min after depletion of extracellular acetate
Channel.Biomaterial-Provider: DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures, organism cultivated by University of Stuttgart, Institute of Biochemical Engineering, Allmandring 31, 70569 Stuttgart
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: The culture medium samples were withdrawn with a capillary sampling probe as developed by Theobald et al. (1997), however, without using membrane-covered glass tubes. The cell samples were collected directly into RNAprotect Bacteria Reagent (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) to avoid RNA degradation. The samples were centrifuged according to the manufacturer’s protocol and frozen at - 80 °C until RNA isolation. Theobald, U., Mailinger,W., Baltes, M., Rizzi, M., Reuss, M., 1997. In vivo analysis of metabolic dynamics in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. 1. Experimental observations. Biotechnol. Bioeng. 55, 305–316.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The fed-batch cultivations were carried out with the bacterial strain E. coli K-12 W3110 (DSM 5911, German Collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures) in a 30-l bioreactor (Bioengineering AG, Wald, Switzerland). Minimal medium supplemented with glucose as the carbon source was used. The batch medium (batch volume VR,0 =17 l) consisted of 8.8 g l−1 glucose•H2O, 2.0 g l−1 Na2SO4•10H2O, 2.68 g l−1 (NH4)2SO4, 1.0 g l−1 NH4Cl, 14.6 g l−1 K2HPO4, 4.02 g l−1 NaH2PO4•2H2O, 0.01 g l−1 thiamine HCl; 0.3mM CaCl2•2H2O, 2mM MgSO4•7H2O; 3ml l−1 of trace element solution (TES: 16.7 g l−1 FeCl3•6H2O, 20.1 g l−1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. Channel.Label: Cy5

Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

The batch medium (batch volume VR,0 =17 l) consisted of 8.8 g l−1 glucose•H2O, 2.0 g l−1 Na2SO4•10H2O, 2.68 g l−1 (NH4)2SO4, 1.0 g l−1 NH4Cl, 14.6 g l−1 K2HPO4, 4.02 g l−1 NaH2PO4•2H2O, 0.01 g l−1 thiamine HCl; 0.3mM CaCl2•2H2O, 2mM MgSO4•7H2O; 3ml l−1 of trace element solution (TES: 16.7 g l−1 FeCl3•6H2O, 20.1 g l−1
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, glucose limitation (glucose concentration < 0.05 gL-1)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, glucose limitation (glucose concentration < 0.05 gL-1)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Channel.Source: E. coli, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. W3110
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, unlimited growth (batch)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.

Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K12 (W3110), fed-batch/linear feed, glucose limitation, 50 min after depletion of extracellular acetate
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA from 8.1*10exp9 cells was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. On-column DNase digestion was performed (RNase free DNase set, Qiagen). RNA concentration and quality were assessed photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc., Delaware, USA), by formaldehyde gel electrophoresis and bioanalyzer analysis (RNA 6000 Nano LabChip Kit, Agilent Bioanalyzer 2100, Agilent Technologies, California, USA). Only RNA with 260 nm / 280 nm ratio of 1.8 - 2 as well as 260 nm / 230 nm ratio > 1.8 was used for precipitation. The RNA was precipitated and resolved at the final concentration of 6 µg / µl required for reverse transcription and labeling with fluorescent dyes. Total RNA isolate was mixed with 1/10 volume of NaCl solution (3 M) and 2 volumes of ethanol (100 %) and stored at -20 °C overnight. The samples were subsequently centrifuged (14000 rpm; 20800 g) and the supernatant was discarded. The RNA was washed with ethanol (70 %) and vacuum dried. 100 µg of RNA were used for reverse transcription.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Concentrated total RNA was reverse transcribed using Superscript II RNase H- Reverse Transcriptase (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) and labeled at the same time. Cy3-dCTPs and Cy5-dCTPs were incorporated and the reverse transcribed probes hybridized on the arrays as described in “Hybridization protocol”. Reverse transcription was carried out as follows: 3 µl random hexanucleotide primers (6 N) and 16.5 µl precipitated RNA were mixed and incubated at 65 °C for 10 min. The reaction mix was then incubated at room temperature for further 10 min and on ice for 2 min. Now 8 µl 5 x RT reaction buffer (Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen), 4 µl dNTP Mastermix (dATP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dGTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dTTP - 100 mM, 5 µl; dCTP - 100 mM, 2 µl ad 100 µl bidestilled RNase free H2O), 4 µl Cy3-dCTP and Cy5-dCTP (1 mM) respectively, 4 µl DTT (0.1 M, Superscript II Kit, Invitrogen) and 1.5 µl Superscript II (200 U, Invitrogen) were added. This mixture was incubated for 2 h at 42 °C. The reaction was stopped by adding 10 µl of a sodium hydroxide solution (1 M) and heating to 65 °C for 10 min. The solution was neutralized by adding 10 µl of hydrochloric acid (1 M). 200 µl 1 x TE buffer was added and the mixture purified using the PCR Purification Kit as recommended by the manufacturer (Qiagen). cDNA concentration was determined photometrically (Nanodrop ND 1000, NanoDrop Technologies, Inc.) and identical amounts of labeled cDNA were combined and vacuum dried at 30 °C until nearly dry. The cDNA was redissolved in 65 µl prewarmed (42 °C) hybridization buffer (MWG) and stored for subsequent use - either on ice for less than 1 h or at -20 °C when stored overnight.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The slides were hybridized in the fully automatic hybridization station HS400 (Tecan Deutschland GmbH, Crailsheim, Germany). Labeled cDNA samples were prepared by heating them to 95 °C for 3 min. The hybridization lasted for 12 h at 42 °C. 6 x SSPE (20 x stock: NaCl 175.3 g; NaH2PO4 x 1H2O 27.6 g; Na2EDTA 7.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) was used for pre-wetting; washing buffer 1 (NaCl 17.6 g; sodium citrate 8.8 g; SDS 1 g; ddH2O ad 1 l) and washing buffer 2 (NaCl 0.88 g; NaCitrate 4.4 g; bidestilled H2O ad 1 l) were used for washing the hybridized slides which were subsequently dried with nitrogen gas for two minutes.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The completely dryed DNA microarrays were scanned using the ScanArray Express Microarray Scanner (Perkin Elmer, Massachusetts, USA) (resolution: 5 µM; PMT setting: 70). Pictures of both channels were saved as 16- bit tiff files.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data were created by analyzing 16-bit tiff files with the Scan Array Express imaging software (microarray analysis system, version 3.0.0.0016, PerkinElmer, Massachusetts, USA; adaptive treshold method, total normalization method). Adaptive threshold (quantitation method) uses the parameters of the spot diameter and background inner and outer dimensions to create a spot mask and background mask, then refines the mask on a pixel-by-pixel basis. Total (normalization method), uses the intensity of each spot in relation to all spots. The VALUE data are normalized log2(test/ref) ratios which were normalized 'print-tip-loess' using the software R (R, 2005) and the Limma package included (Smyth, 2005). Additionally, spots, which were classified as not found by the image analysis software, were down weighted to 10%.
